features: 3-in-1 design with onboard crevice tool allows you to customize your vacuum for your needs. At only 4 pounds, you can take the Eureka blaze anywhere
Eureka's signature swivels steering improves maneuverability and cleaning efficiency when compared to standard stick vacuums

Eureka's capture nozzle picks up larger debris with ease unlike other stick vacuums that push larger particles around. Effectively removes surface dirt and dust from multi-surfaces and leave your home looking and feeling refreshed.
Powerful 2 amp motor picks up particles like dust and pollen, while the washable filtration system captures the debris and improves air quality
18' power cord and X-Large dust cup ensure you get the job done faster - No more outlet hopping or frequent trips to the trash can with the Eureka blaze. 9.44 inch cleaning
Much safer and more environmentally safe package. Passed frustration-free packaging (FFP) Certification
body.description: We know you value a clean home and Eureka is proud to offer whole home cleaning solutions to make life a little easier.Eureka Blaze Stick Vacuum Cleaner is the perfect cleaning companion for your tiny house to live in! This powerful yet lightweight vacuum boasts an impressive suction power, making it ideal for cleaning tiles and hard floors.Equipped with a large, easy-to-clean dust cup and washable filter, this handheld vacuum makes cleaning a breeze. The capture nozzle easily picks up larger debris, while the advanced swivel steering allows for effortless maneuverability around furniture and stairs.The 18-feet power cord provides ample reach for cleaning larger areas, and multiple accessories help clean hard-to-reach crevices and furniture, making this mini vacuum a college dorm room essentials for girls. Don't let its cheap price fool you. Upgrade your cleaning game today!Warning: When using the vacuum cleaner, the floor brush may be clogged by hairs and dirt. We recommend cleaning the roller brush and the belt every 2 weeks.Long-term failure to clean may cause malfunction, or even risk of smoke and belt broken.Dust Cup Capacity (Max Fill): 0.35L.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Key Features 3-in-1 Versatility Transform the Eureka Blaze from a stick vacuum, to a hand vacuum, to a stair vacuum, and back again. This highly customizable vacuum is perfect for all your cleaning needs. Capture Nozzle Large particles are no match for the Eureka Blaze . Watch as the Capture nozzle sucks them all up through the large particle channel. No more snowplowing them across the room. Swivel Steering Speed and efficiency is the name of the game when it comes to quick pickups. Eureka's signature swivel steering makes the BLAZE highly maneuverable and easy to use. 18 ft. Power Cord With 18ft long power cord, allows you to clean from wall to wall. No more outlet hopping.

Ways to Use Stick Vacuum Use the Eureka Blaze in its fully assembled form to keep your living area clean and tidy. Surface dirt and dust from multi-surfaces - the Blaze can handle it all! Hand Vacuum Vacuuming above floors? Use the hand vacuum to keep your whole home spotless. Whether its cleaning up after dinner or vacuuming Buster's doggie bed, the Blaze hand vac has you covered. Crevice Tool Attached The crevice tool is perfect for cleaning hard to reach places. Whether its between your couch cushions or under the seats in your car, the crevice tool is a time saver. Stair Vacuum Use the hand vac and Capture nozzle to make cleaning your stairs a breeze.

Eureka Blaze 3-in-1 Swivel Handheld & Stick Vacuum Cleaner Eureka 3-in-1 Lightweight Stick Vacuum Cleaner Eureka 3-in-1, NES310 Filter Set for Blaze, NES210 Weight 3.2 lbs 2.75 lbs 4.0 lbs Power 2 Amps 2 Amps 2.5 Amps Motor Wattage 240 W 240 W 300 W Cord Length 18 ft 18 ft 16.4 ft Cleaning Path 9.5 inches 9.6 inches 10 inches Attachment Crevice Tool crevice tool Built-in Crevice Tool and Dusting Brush Swivel Steering ✓ ✓ ✓ Why Buy Efficient on laminate, hardwood, tile, linoleum. Perfect for quick cleanups. Clean up pet hairs and litters. Lite design. Stand upright by itself for easier storage. Extremly Lightweight, Powerful Suction Swivel Steering, Freestanding, Low-maintenance & Easy to Assemble. Built-in Versatile Tools, Lightweight & Easy to Maneuver, Motorized Brushroll, Long Stick for High-Above

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cleaning Made Effortless with the EUREKA Home Lightweight Mini Cleaner! 🌪️
reviews.reviewText: I recently invested in the "EUREKA Home Lightweight Mini Cleaner for Carpet and Hard Floor Corded Stick Vacuum" from Amazon, and it has truly revolutionized my cleaning routine!Pros:Feather-Light and Maneuverable: This stick vacuum lives up to its lightweight claim, making it a breeze to carry around the house and navigate through tight spaces effortlessly.Powerful Suction: Don't let its size fool you; this mini cleaner packs a punch when it comes to suction power. It efficiently tackles both carpet and hard floor surfaces with ease.Corded Convenience: No worrying about battery life! The corded design ensures a consistent and powerful performance throughout the entire cleaning session.Overall Impression:The EUREKA Home Mini Cleaner has made cleaning a surprisingly enjoyable task. Its lightweight design doesn't compromise on power, and the corded feature ensures I can clean without interruption. Perfect for quick pickups and daily maintenance, it has become my go-to solution for keeping my home spotless. If you're in search of a reliable, compact vacuum, this one is a game-changer! 🌟🧹 #EUREKAVacuum #CleaningEssentials #HomeMaintenance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for price! Ideal for ease of use and small spaces.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Ideal for those who would struggle with a heavy vacuum, and small spaces. Long cord (apx 20 feet)Works on thick carpeting but not as well, as seen in the video. The carpet shown is a thick nap very old 1980's carpet. And the white stuff is that white flocking off a Christmas tree that nearly velcro's itself to the carpet. So the fact it's getting any at all is very impressive. Putting a little weight into it and it works about as well as a full powered vacuum.Ideal for bedrooms, stairs, and slick floors or thin carpets or rugs. It works on heavier carpet but not as well and easily. Still, for the cost, it's doing great!Small so it's also great for if you don't have a large storage space for cleaning supplies.I feel like it's perfect for small daily cleaning. But would still keep a heavy, high powered vacuum too if there's the option for deeper clean needs or larger spaces like a large living room.It swivels well and you get used to it fast.Very simple assembly, 3 main parts and a small plastic piece - the handle and long metal bar are one piece, the vacuum and plug a second, and the brushes attachment on the end the 3rd. There's the handheld attachment and a small plastic piece it attaches to at the end of the metal bar.Only disapointment is there's no suction at all without one of the attachments. It works great for getting underneath things, but I did notice a couple of times that I accidentally bumped the power button doing so.A side facing power button and if possible a mid sized attachment or just being able to use it without attachments would make it absolutely perfect.But for under $40?I feel like this is a great value for the money and has terrific suction for what you've bought.Picked up hair and dust bunnies on hard surface floors or thin carpets the first time.Easy to dump out and clean too. I love that the filter can be washed as well.Thank you to this company! Great Christmas gift for an elderly family member who needed something lighter! I would definitely recommend it as an economical and space saving option!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I’m very happy with this vacuum. I didn’t have a lot of money to spend, and my previous vacuums have all broken or blown up in the last month which sucked. I had purchased a dirt devil handheld and it burnt out after one heavy duty vacuuming session I didn’t anticipate. Three weeks of having it. My other one got a giant sock stuck in it and was not able to be reached to come out w out cutting the tubing. It is fall here in New York and it is rainy, muddy, and lots of shredded leaves everywhere. I have been out of my mind being unable to vacuum our apartment all this time. I finally ordered this vacuum yesterday, got it today, and I am already very happy. I used it immediately upon receipt and it was a dream. It rolled over hardwood floors very smoothly and picked up all sorts of crumbs in the kitchen. I used it in the bathroom to vacuum up stray hairs. I used it in my sons room to pick up spilled formula powder on the wood floor, and other dirt on his area rug. I used it in our master bedroom which is carpeted. I was able to clearly see dirt and particles being lifted off of a very low pile carpet. I used it in my living room and it picked up everything perfectly. I have lots of different flooring in my rental apartment. This thing was perfect. Even though it’s basically a handheld dust vac with a floor attachment, I never got the feeling that it was. The suction is very good, such that wherever I put that thing it sucked stuff up, even along the outer areas of the floor attachment. Ok rugs it works best going backward towards you, as it skips along the rug when pushed fwd but I jsut did it nice and slow and I am confident it was picking up dirt and hair. I even used it on a small shag rug. I did not detach the handheld for that option this time, but I fully intend to in the future. Although it was far more comfortable in its full upright mode. And it’s so lightweight and portable I don’t foresee using it as a handheld only very often. my pictures show what it looks like fully upright, up close, and the canister with contents after my very first use of it. I cannot even believe how much crap there was on my floors in just like a week of not vacuuming. I had been sweeping during that time and was grossed out seeing how much was actually on the floors despite that. I love having visuals like seeing the grossness in the canister lol. The bagless canister is convenient, I am used to vacuums like that and I know that they are very easy to clean and the filter is rinsable. I saw some reviews mention the length of the cord. I actually did not really have too much of a problem with that. I could have used it being 5 feet longer or more but Another 2 feet would not have mattered to me at all. Whether it’s 10 feetOr 12ft wouldn’t make or break a vacuum session for me. Our apartment isn’t small but it’s nothing close to a house. I do have a million outlets all over my apartment so it really wasn’t difficult. It swivels nicely and I can totally get it into weird angles and zoom around the floors nicely. I plan to use it on my entryway and the stairs up to my apartment tomorrow. Those are completely destroyed from leaves and all sorts of crap. So far I am very happy with this purchase! Excellent price excellent suction, excellent results.Update 2 weeks later: I use this vaccum about four times a week. I still use it on all sorts of surfaces like carpet, floor, stairs, entry way, play mat, couch, etc. I am still very happy w the suction and effectiveness of the vacuum. As I’ve used it more and more there are some annoyances that’s rent major but certainly worth mentioning: 1) the feature of just using it as a hand vac is impractical in my opinion. If I am vacuuming and decide I want to spot clean something w the hand vac option it is very cumbersome to achieve. Between the long handle piece and trying to yank out the floor attachment it ends up being far mor effort than is necessary when I jsut end up using the floor attachment on whatever. If I am going to use the hand vac alone it is from the beginning, not during a routine vacuuming. So I’d recommend doing it that way in general. 2) the swivel feature is fantastic but sometimes causes twisting and tangling of the cord around the lower part of the vacuum. Also if you want to lift the vacuum to move it while vacuuming it can often spin and you’re like twisting the whole thing around to get it back in line w itself. 3) the power switch being on the hand vac and fairly low down is a pain. I know there’s really no other way to do it but it is a little annoying. Otherwise though I am super happy w this purchase especially for the price. It is perfect for an apartment, or as a basement vacuum or for other smaller spaces that you don’t want to lug a giant heavy vacuum. I did clean the filter and canister once and it was very easy. The filter dried by the window in about two hours. I still love it and totally recommend it.UPDATE 2/12 months later**** still loving it. I use it about every other day. I’ve cleaned the filter many times no issues. Suction still seems good. It’s been picking up small Christmas tree pine needles perfectly. It does not like hair embedded into carpet, even low pile. I had a baby a few months ago and my hair is starting to shed horribly now. I get insane about stepping on hair so I vacuum a lot. But I thought it was picking up hair on the rug in our living room and just for sh*ts and giggles I took tape and used it on the rug to see, and basically every hair I’ve ever shed was still in the carpet. Hardwood floor? Yes no problem but carpets no. At least now I know lol. Otherwise it’s just a simple and generally effective little vacuum. Still recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Picks up and cleans well
reviews.reviewText: It's a powerful little tool to ha e around. It's versatile and has a long cord. I like that the attachments are handy for various cleaning. I bought mine for work. Tje cleaning staff leaves a lot to be desired so I manage my own office. I like it vacuumed and dusted daily. It was very inexpensive and helps me get the job done in minutes. It's lightweight and not bulky. I bought one for my daughter when she went to college for her room. She loves it too.

Hasta ahora todo bien, cumple su función, aspira bien y su precio es accesible, ya que otras aspiradoras eran mucho más caras, esta es suficiente para lo que la necesito, que es es aspirar los pelos de perro de mis mascotas del piso y polvo. En los sillones también funciona pero hay que pasarla más veces porque no tiene tanta succión en ese tipo de superficie ya que luego los pelitos se quedan como incrustados en la tela y es un poco más tardado retirarlos.El deposito de la aspiradora no es muy grande, para aspirar toda la casa tengo que vaciarlo un par de veces, pero no es algo que tome mucho tiempo, es fácil de utilizarla y ligera. La recomiendo.

Me llegó relativamente hace poco y apenas la he podido usar en 2 ocasiones pero desde la primera vez que la usé quedé fascinada con lo fácil y rápido que es limpiar con ella.La compré porque tengo un gato y la cantidad de pelo que tira es muchísima y ya había escuchado y leído muy buenos comentarios sobre esta marca y en especial este modelo y otro más.No me decepcionó para nada, es liviana, la puedes usar de 3 maneras diferentes ya que trae accesorios tanto para usarla para aspirar pisos como espacio más pequeños y estrechos. Principalmente sirve para suelos duros, pero la usé para aspirar telas y funciona bien. Incluye un solo filtro que es completamente lavable y muy fácil de quitar/poner, y un cable de muy buen grosor y tamaño.Recomendación: al terminar de usarla, hay que retirar toda la basura que aspiró y lavar el filtro con agua y de manera delicada para que no se dañe la tela, dejar secar y volver a poner. Los repuestos los venden en amazon y no son tan caros.Importante saber que la aspiradora NO es para aspirar líquidos, así que hay que tener cuidado con eso.

reviews.reviewTitle: Funciona de maravilla, pero no hay refacciones... Pero lo puedes arreglar
reviews.reviewText: Esta aspiradora es muy buena, potente...La utilizo para aspirar la casa en lugar de barrer porque tengo 3 chihuahuas peluditos (Y si que tiran pelos, y de los finitos).Tiene un problema esta aspiradora y es que después de unos meses empieza a hacer un ruido extraño y parece ser que pierde potencia de aspirar, incluso dejó de moverse el rodillo de la aspiradora de piso, pero el problema solo es con ese accesorio!Y es fácil de arreglar, lo único que hay que hacer es quitar los tornillos de ese accesorio y buscar un trozo de madera que pueda emparejar la banda del rodillo jajajajaNo importa si lo abres... Realmente este modelo no tiene garantía...De ahí en más, sigue funcionando al 100 y también la puedes usar para aspirar la cama o tapetes y lo hace bien :)

lots of suction...great for quick clean ups...especially on hard surfaces...I have used it on my vintage rugs and it works quite well. I wish someone would invent a stick vacuum that had a hose attached for those hard to reach places.
